channel.title: Things are just...getting stupid now
channel.description:
Apparently..even the word "negro" (inb4 I get banned by Tom for saying it on here >.>) is considered a racist remark? It is the Spanish word for "black" The COLOR black. I said I had a negro sheep in my pitfall, and Tom got all pissy saying that it's just as racist as n***er. Now...I accepted the fact..kinda..that racism and sexism were put against the rules. I'd have to say that I agree and disagree with that choice, I don't like racism (The actual looking down on someone, or doing things unfair to someone just because of their race) Or sexism (Actually making a woman belittle herself or beating a woman, etc.). When I've heard so many black people make "black jokes" and use the "n word" (All forms of it.) Shit..in todays society here in America it is used as a greeting. "What's up my nigga?" I also don't see what it sexist about joking around about women and sandwichs.
Oh well...the main thing that got me to posting this topic is the fact that the word negro was made to look like a racist remark..It was not used in a racist way, it was used as a color of a sheep, but apparently it's racist.
I wonder what next is gonna be considered "racist" when it's not.

item.title: Things are just...getting stupid now
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

This is an ENGLISH speaking server, and the word has been woven into the ENGLISH language.

People still try to see it like this:

nig·ger
   [nig-er] Show IPA
Usage note
The term nigger  is now probably the most offensive word in English. Its degree of offensiveness has increased markedly in recent years, although it has been used in a derogatory manner since at least the Revolutionary War. Definitions 1a, 1b, and 2 represent meanings that are deeply disparaging and are used when the speaker deliberately wishes to cause great offense. Definition 1a, however, is sometimes used among African-Americans in a neutral or familiar way. Definition 3 is not normally considered disparaging—as in “The Irish are the niggers of Europe” from Roddy Doyle's The Commitments —but the other uses are considered contemptuous and hostile.

noun
1.
Slang: Extremely Disparaging and Offensive
     a. a black person
     b. a member of any dark-skinned people.
2. Slang: Extremely Disparaging and Offensive . a person of any race or origin regarded as contemptible, inferior, ignorant, etc.
3. a victim of prejudice similar to that suffered by blacks; a person who is economically, politically, or socially disenfranchised.

When it reality, it’s mostly like this: A word that everyone else is afraid to define except in utter seriousness, for fear of being branded a rascist, in total ignorance of the colloquial usage of the word, its characterization in popular culture, and the populations of people it is used most by.

Racism is the general belief that one race is better then another. I can firmly say that 99% of the common users of this forum are not racist, but instead a number of them just young, idiotic or immature. I realize that nothing I can say will change your general standpoint on the word, and I have no problem with racism being not allowed, but as a word, let’s just face it, it’s a word. Racism is only based off of your interpretation of the word. I don’t mean in things like context (even though that does make a difference) but it’s all about how people, as individuals, process that word in their brain and believe what it really means. No one word is racist, no one word is not racist. I could say “those people” and it be taken as racist, or I could say “chink” and someone be perfectly ok with it. There is no one true meaning behind a single word, and no one single belief to follow up on it. Words can change, words have changed, and words will continue to change.
